resource-agent.name: fence_scsi
resource-agent.shortdesc: Fence agent for SCSI persistent reservation
resource-agent.longdesc:
fence_scsi is an I/O Fencing agent that uses SCSI-3 persistent reservations to control access to shared storage devices. These devices must support SCSI-3 persistent reservations (SPC-3 or greater) as well as the "preempt-and-abort" subcommand. The fence_scsi agent works by having each node in the cluster register a unique key with the SCSI device(s). Reservation key is generated from "node id" (default) or from "node name hash" (RECOMMENDED) by adjusting "key_value" option. Using hash is recommended to prevent issues when removing nodes from cluster without full cluster restart. Once registered, a single node will become the reservation holder by creating a "write exclusive, registrants only" reservation on the device(s). The result is that only registered nodes may write to the device(s). When a node failure occurs, the fence_scsi agent will remove the key belonging to the failed node from the device(s). The failed node will no longer be able to write to the device(s). A manual reboot is required.
When used as a watchdog device you can define e.g. retry=1, retry-sleep=2 and verbose=yes parameters in /etc/sysconfig/stonith if you have issues with it failing.

parameter.name: action
parameter.shortdesc: Fencing action

parameter.name: aptpl
parameter.shortdesc: Use the APTPL flag for registrations. This option is only used for the 'on' action.

parameter.name: devices
parameter.shortdesc: List of devices to use for current operation. Devices can be comma or space separated list of raw devices (eg. /dev/sdc). Each device must support SCSI-3 persistent reservations. Optional if cluster is configured with clvm or lvmlockd.

parameter.name: key
parameter.shortdesc: Key to use for the current operation. This key should be unique to a node. For the "on" action, the key specifies the key use to register the local node. For the "off" action, this key specifies the key to be removed from the device(s).

parameter.name: plug
parameter.shortdesc: Name of the node to be fenced. The node name is used to generate the key value used for the current operation. This option will be ignored when used with the -k option.

parameter.name: port
parameter.shortdesc: Name of the node to be fenced. The node name is used to generate the key value used for the current operation. This option will be ignored when used with the -k option.

parameter.name: readonly
parameter.shortdesc: Open DEVICE read-only.

parameter.name: suppress-errors
parameter.shortdesc: Error log suppression.

parameter.name: suppress_errors
parameter.shortdesc: Error log suppression.

parameter.name: logfile
parameter.shortdesc: Log output (stdout and stderr) to file

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.shortdesc: Disable logging to stderr. Does not affect --verbose or --debug-file or logging to syslog.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.shortdesc: Verbose mode. Multiple -v flags can be stacked on the command line (e.g., -vvv) to increase verbosity.

parameter.name: verbose_level
parameter.shortdesc: Level of debugging detail in output. Defaults to the number of --verbose flags specified on the command line, or to 1 if verbose=1 in a stonith device configuration (i.e., on stdin).

parameter.name: debug
parameter.shortdesc: Write debug information to given file

parameter.name: debug_file
parameter.shortdesc: Write debug information to given file

parameter.name: version
parameter.shortdesc: Display version information and exit

parameter.name: help
parameter.shortdesc: Display help and exit

parameter.name: plug_separator
parameter.shortdesc: Separator for plug parameter when specifying more than 1 plug

parameter.name: delay
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds before fencing is started

parameter.name: disable_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Disable timeout (true/false) (default: true when run from Pacemaker 2.0+)

parameter.name: login_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds for cmd prompt after login

parameter.name: power_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Test X seconds for status change after ON/OFF

parameter.name: power_wait
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds after issuing ON/OFF

parameter.name: shell_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds for cmd prompt after issuing command

parameter.name: stonith_status_sleep
parameter.shortdesc: Sleep X seconds between status calls during a STONITH action

parameter.name: retry_on
parameter.shortdesc: Count of attempts to retry power on

parameter.name: corosync_cmap_path
parameter.shortdesc: Path to corosync-cmapctl binary

parameter.name: key_value
parameter.shortdesc: Method used to generate the SCSI key. "id" (default) uses the positional ID from "corosync-cmactl nodelist" output which can get inconsistent when nodes are removed from cluster without full cluster restart. "hash" uses part of hash made out of node names which is not affected over time but there is theoretical chance that hashes can collide as size of SCSI key is quite limited.

parameter.name: sg_persist_path
parameter.shortdesc: Path to sg_persist binary

parameter.name: sg_turs_path
parameter.shortdesc: Path to sg_turs binary

parameter.name: vgs_path
parameter.shortdesc: Path to vgs binary
